   1 # This class provides one interface for creating simple methods to perform general and routine database operations on a set of items,
   2 # as well as providing one interface to the database through Rose::DB::Object classes
   3 
   4 package VulnDB;
   5 
   6 use 5.008;
   7 use strict;
   8 use warnings;
   9 use Carp;

  44 use base qw(Class::Accessor);
  45 # create nice accessors -- i.e. <get> = $vulndb->user -- <set> = $vulndb->user($someuser)
  46 VulnDB->mk_accessors( qw(user user_mgr criteria_type criteria_type_mgr message message_mgr message_type
  47                         message_type_mgr source source_mgr user_alert_method user_alert_method_mgr
  48                         user_criteria user_criteria_mgr user_profile user_profile_mgr 
  49                         user_source user_source_mgr) );
  50 
  51 our $VERSION = '0.01';
  52 
  53 sub new {
  54     #In: None
  55     #Do: instantiate new object that allows single object access to all Rose ORM table/row and table/manager classes
  56     #Out: vulnDB object
  57     my $class   = shift;
  58 
  59 
  60     
  61     my $self = {
  62                     user                   => 'VulnDB::RDBO::AuthUser',
  63                     user_mgr               => 'VulnDB::RDBO::AuthUser::Manager',
  64                     criteria_type          => 'VulnDB::RDBO::CriteriaType',
  65                     criteria_type_mgr      => 'VulnDB::RDBO::CriteriaType::Manager',
  66                     message                => 'VulnDB::RDBO::Message',
  67                     message_mgr            => 'VulnDB::RDBO::Message::Manager',
  68                     message_type           => 'VulnDB::RDBO::MessageType',
  69                     message_type_mgr       => 'VulnDB::RDBO::MessageType::Manager',
  70                     source                 => 'VulnDB::RDBO::Source',
  71                     source_mgr             => 'VulnDB::RDBO::Source::Manager',
  72                     user_alert_method      => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserAlertMethod',
  73                     user_alert_method_mgr  => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserAlertMethod::Manager',
  74                     user_criteria          => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserCriteria',
  75                     user_criteria_mgr      => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserCriteria::Manager',
  76                     user_message           => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserMessage',
  77                     user_message_mgr       => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserMessage::Manager',
  78                     user_profile           => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserProfile',
  79                     user_profile_mgr       => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserProfile::Manager',
  80                     user_source            => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserSource',
  81                     user_source_mgr        => 'VulnDB::RDBO::UserSource::Manager',
  82                 };
  83     bless $self, $class;
  84 
  85     return $self;
  86 }

  89 ### INSERTIONS ###
  90 
  91 sub insert_msg {
  92     #In: reference to list of VulnMessage object(s) along with a single identifying 'source' and 'type' names that covers all msgs in this call
  93     #Do: Insert all message objects contained in this instance into db
  94     #Out: None
  95     
  96     open my $logfile, ">>", "logs/logfile.txt";
  97 
  98     my $self            = shift;
  99     my $msg_list_ref    = shift;
 100     my @msg_list        = @$msg_list_ref;
 101     my $source_name     = shift;
 102     my $msg_type_name       = shift;
 103 
 104 
 105     my $user_mgr = $self->user_mgr;
 106     my $users = $user_mgr->get_auth_user();
 107 
 108     # instantiate message row and table handlers
 109     my $message            = $self->message;
 110     my $message_mgr        = $self->message_mgr;
 111 
 112     # instantiate source and message_type table handlers
 113     my $source_mgr         = $self->source_mgr;
 114     my $message_type_mgr   = $self->message_type_mgr;
 115 
 116     # get source and message type objects
 117     my $source          = @{$source_mgr->get_source( query => [ name => $source_name, ] )}[0];
 118     my $message_type    = @{$message_type_mgr->get_message_type( query => [ name => $msg_type_name, ] )}[0];
 119 
 120     for my $msg ( @msg_list ) {
 121         my $msg_row = $message->new( 
 122                                     text        => $msg->msg,
 123                                     subject     => $msg->subject,
 124                                     body        => $msg->body,
 125                                     source_id   => $source->id,
 126                                     message_type_id     => $message_type->id,
 127                                 );
 128         eval {
 129             $msg_row->save();
 130         };
 131 
 132         # write error to log if save fails
 133         if ($@) {
 134             my $cur_datetime = localtime();
 135             print $logfile $cur_datetime . ": " . $msg_row->error . "\n";
 136         }
 137     }
 138 
 139     close $logfile;
 140 }
 141 
 142 ### CRITERIA ###
 143 
 144 sub find_msgs_by_user {
 145     # given a userobj ref find all is_processed=0 messages that match user's criteria and sources and return an arrayref of message objects
 146     #IN: user:          user object reference
 147     #    opt_params:  array ref of extra field/value pairs, i.e. ['is_mailed', 1, is_processed, 0]
 148     #OUT: array ref of message object refs
 149 
 150     my $self = shift;
 151     my $user = shift;
 152     my $opt_params = shift;
 153     $opt_params = [] if not defined($opt_params);
 154 
 155     my @messages;
 156     # find out whether we should use advanced or simple prefs
 157     my $profile = ${$self->user_profile_mgr->get_user_profile(query => [user_id => $user->id] )}[0];  #get_user_profile(user_id => $user->id)}[0]; -- apparent Rose bug (always gets user_id=1)
 158     my $criteria_pref_type = $profile->criteria_pref_type;
 159     # get this user's criteria, then go through each set, find msgs that match and add to msg hash based on subject (so duplicates will get caught)
 160     my $user_criteria_mgr = $self->user_criteria_mgr;
 161     my @user_criteria     = @{$user_criteria_mgr->get_user_criteria( query => [ user_id => $user->id ] )};
 162 
 163 
 164     for my $criteria (@user_criteria) {
 165         if ($criteria->criteria_type->criteria_pref_type eq $criteria_pref_type) {
 166             # get user's selected sources
 167             my @sources;
 168             for my $source (@{$profile->sources}) {
 169                 push(@sources, $source->id);
 170             }
 171 
 172             my $search_field    = $criteria->criteria_type->search_field;
 173             my $value           = $criteria->value;
 174             my $qualifier_rose   = $criteria->qualifier->rose;
 175             my $rose_sql_transform = $criteria->qualifier->rose_sql;
 176 
 177             # account for rose:db:object's inconvenient way of proclaiming NOT which disrupts my beautifully crafted database schema which otherwise abstract all this out
 178             if ($criteria->qualifier->name =~ /^not/) {
 179                 $search_field = "!" . $search_field;
 180             }
 181 
 182             # replace %s in rose_sql_transform with value we're searching for
 183             $rose_sql_transform =~ s/%s/$value/;
 184 
 185             my $params = [ $search_field => { $qualifier_rose => $rose_sql_transform }, source_id => \@sources ];
 186             push (@$params, @$opt_params);
 187 
 188             push @messages, @{$self->message_mgr->get_message( query => $params ) }
 189         }
 190     }
 191     # weed out duplicates (find a better solution for this)
 192     my %msgs = ();
 193     for my $msg (@messages) {
 194         $msgs{ $msg->id } = $msg;
 195     }
 196     # convert back to array
 197     my @unique_msgs = ();
 198     for my $msg_id (keys %msgs) {
 199         push @unique_msgs, $msgs{$msg_id};
 200     }
 201 
 202     return \@unique_msgs;
 203 }
 204 
 205 sub add_user_msgs {
 206     # given an argument hash of a user and an arrayref of message objects, adds them to the user's set of messages
 207     #FIXME: if it finds any msg_ids that have already been added it will fail and no message will be added -- this should never happen, but...
 208     
 209     open my $logfile, ">>", "logs/logfile.txt";
 210 
 211     my $self = shift;
 212     my $args = shift;
 213     my $user = $args->{user};
 214     my @msgs = @{$args->{msgs}};
 215 
 216     my $num_msgs = @msgs;
 217     return if ($num_msgs == 0);
 218 
 219     my $user_profile = ${$self->user_profile_mgr->get_user_profile( query => [ user_id => $user->id ] )}[0];
 220 
 221     $user_profile->add_messages( @msgs );
 222     
 223     eval {
 224         $user_profile->save;
 225     };
 226     
 227     # write error to log if save fails
 228     if ($@) {
 229         my $cur_datetime = localtime();
 230         print $logfile $cur_datetime . ": VulnDB->add_user_msgs->\$user->profile->save() -- " . $user_profile->error . "\n";
 231     }
 232 
 233     close $logfile;
 234 
 235 
 236     
 237 }
 238 
 239 
 240 ######## ERROR CHECKING ########
 241 
 242 sub is_valid_user {
 243 
 244     my $self = shift;
 245     my $args = shift;
 246     my $username = $args->{user} || '';
 247     my $email    = $args->{email} || '';
 248     my @users    = ();
 249 
 250 
 251     if ($username) {
 252         @users = @{ $self->user_mgr->get_auth_user( query => [ username => $username ] )};
 253     } elsif ($email) {
 254         @users = @{ $self->user_mgr->get_auth_user( query => [ email    => $email ]  )};
 255     } else {
 256         croak "email or username required\n";
 257     }
 258 
 259     if (not @users) {
 260         return 0;
 261     } else {
 262         return 1;
 263     }
 264 
 265 }
